update.description:
~~Accompanies handsim-proprietary [PR#26](#!/osrf/handsim-proprietary/pull-request/26/added-collision-shapes-and-contact-sensors/diff).~~

~~Depends on a small fix to Gazebo in [PR#1413](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1413/allow-multiple-contact-sensors-per-link) which allows multiple contact sensors per link~~ contact sensor fix merged.

Changes the hand graphic and the contact sensor visualization graphics to visualize the new contact sensors. Also changed the sensor visualization to rectangles, not circles, added the ability to vary the sizes of the displayed contact areas, and enabled different transparency of contact areas that receive no contact.

![squarecontacts.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/rnoXja/images/1466788893-squarecontacts.png)
update.title: Changed contact sensor locations and image

pullrequest.title: Changed contact sensor locations and image

content.raw:
If we execute the change correctly, nothing. The only thing that matters in this PR are the <index> elements in the GUIPlugin SDF:

```
          <contact name="mpl::rPalm0">
            <pos>85 200</pos>
            **<index>0</index>**
            <size>50 100</size>
          </contact>
```
If we keep the ordering of contact sensors consistent with the plugin SDF in the new sanitized model, nothing will have to change here.

Actually, it occurs to me that it would help if the palm of the new model had simple collision shapes that approximated the areas that I use for contact sensors (change for old handsim-proprietary is implemented in #!/osrf/handsim-proprietary/pull-request/26/added-collision-shapes-and-contact-sensors)
content.html:
If we execute the change correctly, nothing. The only thing that matters in this PR are the <index> elements in the GUIPlugin SDF:

          <contact name="mpl::rPalm0">
            <pos>85 200</pos>
            **<index>0</index>**
            <size>50 100</size>
          </contact>

If we keep the ordering of contact sensors consistent with the plugin SDF in the new sanitized model, nothing will have to change here.

Actually, it occurs to me that it would help if the palm of the new model had simple collision shapes that approximated the areas that I use for contact sensors (change for old handsim-proprietary is implemented in #!/osrf/handsim-proprietary/pull-request/26/added-collision-shapes-and-contact-sensors)

* Palm_1
* Hand-edge
* Hand-top
